title: Reaction when your bot lane says "WE GOT THIS GUIZE WE'RE DUO" then feeds

replies.body:
havent seen a wrestling match since "The Rock" was a part of it.
Do you smell what the rock is cookin?
:P

Smells like betrayal.


{{champion:429}} Yes?



No Kalista...not you...
That's basically me when someone refers to WWE as Fighting/Wrestling when in reality its really more like glorified Dancing.
I honestly haven't had that many bad experiences with duo bot lanes.  Sometimes they win lane, sometimes they lose.
Uhh yeah... sometimes they lose. That's what this meme is.
But then what does duo bot have to do with it? You objectively have a 50-50 chance that your bot lane will lose in any given match.

It's more making fun of the people who brag that they will completely dominate because they're together, but then end up not delivering. Their overconfidence is what annoys people. That and sometimes there's that duo that thinks that they should just get botlane because they queued together. So if they end up forcing you into another lane and then end up losing, you feel just a little bit resentful.
Also the reaction when a duo takes your two best roles and sticks you against a champion that counters all the champions you play mid, then blames you for the loss.
Even scarier when they don't feed, since that means they're probably gonna want to 2v5 all game after lane ends.

80% of the time, duo que bot lanes will feed hard and blame the team. Usually followed by a 2 man ragequit afterwards.

19% of the time they will win lane, but feed late game trying to 2v5 and not help the team get objectives.

1% of the time they actually do well in lane, group up late game and push objectives to win the game.
In my 15 years of playing this game professionally....this has happened to me once. Back when I was in bronze where most people just don't care about the game.
